harden.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to become firm or stiff, or to make something firm or stiff
harden.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: It will take about 24 hours for the glue to harden.
harden.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if your attitude hardens, or if something hardens it, you become more strict and determined and less sympathetic
harden.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Attitudes towards the terrorists have hardened even more since the attack.
harden.translation[0].definitions[2].def: if your face or voice hardens, or if something hardens it, you look or sound less sympathetic or happy
harden.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: His face hardened momentarily, then he looked away.
harden.translation[1].definitions[0].def: if prices on a financial market harden, they go up
